DorlandsPre = t_13 | DorlandsSuf = 12812454 | }} The 'adenoid', also known as a
'pharyngeal tonsil' or 'nasopharyngeal tonsil', is a mass of lymphatic tissue
situated posterior to the nasal cavity, in the roof of the nasopharynx, where
the nose blends into the throat. Normally, in children, it forms a soft mound in
the roof and posterior wall of the nasopharynx, just above and behind the uvula.
